intro: Eriogonum hieraciifolium, commonly known as the woolly filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures. Eriogonum hieraciifolium is an important component of local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
